alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 30 at 9:23PM PST until January 02 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County zone. For the Pit River...including Canby...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding in Canby and Lookout in Modoc County and Beiber and Nubeiber in Lassen County 4300 cfs * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday evening, peaking at 8.6 feet, then possibly dropping below flood stage around noon Monday. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 915 AM PST.
